SEO vs. SMM: Why They Need to Work Together

For those who are new to the world of Search Engine Optimization, they can easily get confused between the terms SEO and SMM. To this, many people ask which one they need. They also ask what the difference is between the two. This is why this article has been created to answer such issues.

In a nutshell, SEO is simply a division or a compartment of Search Engine Marketing. On the other hand Social Media Marketing (SMM) refers to the task of marketing a website on the internet as well as on social networking sites. While Search Engine Optimization is needed for a website to get a high rank on a search engine, the latter makes sure that these websites get noticed by social media platforms.

With the emergence of several networking sites, it is now common to find lots of people advertising their websites on these arenas. This is where people who do SMM come into consideration. Their main job is to introduce the presence of the website to social forums and meeting places such as Facebook and in chat rooms. They can even do as much as have a separate blog to make sure they give out valuable information to people who need to get redirected to the website.

Meanwhile, SEO simply focuses on the content that can catch the attention of the readers and the search engines. They no longer worry about the presence of the website on social media sites because their main job is to make sure that the website gets a good place on a search engine’s rank. For this, they start dropping links on various article submission sites and even answer forums. They simply want to drive more traffic to the website so that more people will get to notice that such website exists.

It is easy to interchange the two because they are alike in many ways. Although it is the role of an SEO to drive traffic to the website, it is often the job of a SMM practitioner which becomes more successful. This is why people who optimize a website can also work as a social media marketer. Their jobs can easily be confused with one another. This is why they go perfectly well when they are combined.

One cannot do a successful website optimization without the use of SMM. This is because nowadays, people are so into social networking sites. They often find the information they need on such websites. By combining these two, a website can be sure to get the exposure it needs to obtain a number of people on a daily basis. This is why it is also advised that they should not work without the other.
